snippet: Belgian authorities halted public transit and warned citizens to avoid public places after a “serious and imminent” threat of a Paris-style terrorist attack.
abstract: Belgian authorities respond to threats of terror attacks following November terrorist attacks in Paris by shutting down subway system and enforcing complete lock down in Brussels; discovery of weapons in borough of Molenbeek, where three of Paris attackers lived, prompted security alert.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins reported from Brussels and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Amsterdam. Milan Schreuer contributed reporting from Brussels, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Belgian authorities halted public transit and warned citizens to avoid public places after a “serious and imminent” threat of a Paris-style terrorist attack.

headline.main: Brussels Placed at Highest Alert Level; Subway Is Closed
headline.print_headline: Belgian Authorities Put Capital on High Alert, Shutting Subway System
